metadata.title: French for a Romantic Getaway
metadata.description: Learning French to charm my way through a magical Parisian adventure!

curriculum.lesson_topic: French for a Romantic Getaway in Paris

sub_topics.sub_topic: Greetings and Introductions: Setting the Mood
sub_topics.description: Learn essential greetings, polite phrases, and basic introductions to make a charming first impression.

sub_topics.sub_topic: Ordering Food and Wine: A Culinary Romance
sub_topics.description: Master the art of ordering food and wine in French to create a delightful and romantic dining experience.

sub_topics.sub_topic: Asking for Directions: Discovering Hidden Gems
sub_topics.description: Learn how to ask for and understand directions in French to navigate the charming streets of Paris with confidence.

sub_topics.sub_topic: Expressing Affection: Sweet Nothings in French
sub_topics.description: Discover romantic vocabulary and phrases to express your affection and admiration in French.

sub_topics.sub_topic: Making Reservations and Plans: A Seamless Experience
sub_topics.description: Learn how to make reservations for restaurants, shows, and other activities, ensuring a smooth and unforgettable romantic getaway.

flashcards.example: Paris est la ville de l'amour.
Je veux te baiser sous la Tour Eiffel.
Ce restaurant a une ambiance très romantique.
Faisons une promenade le long de la Seine.
Ce voyage à Paris est un rêve.

exercises.sentence: Pour notre dîner romantique, j'ai ___ une table dans ce charmant restaurant.
exercises.explanation: 'Réservé' (reserved) fits the context of securing a table for a romantic dinner. 'Mangé' (ate), 'commandé' (ordered), and 'préparé' (prepared) do not logically follow from the context of booking a table.

exercises.sentence: En se promenant le long de la Seine, nous avons ___ les magnifiques ponts illuminés.
exercises.explanation: 'Admiré' (admired) best describes enjoying the beautiful, illuminated bridges. 'Traversé' (crossed), 'ignoré' (ignored), and 'évité' (avoided) don't suit the romantic context.

exercises.sentence: Je veux t'offrir quelque chose de spécial, alors j'ai ___ ce parfum exquis pour toi.
exercises.explanation: 'Choisi' (chose) implies selecting something special, like a perfume. 'Acheté' (bought) is too general, 'créé' (created) doesn't fit the act of gifting, and 'trouvé' (found) suggests randomness, not a deliberate selection.

exercises.sentence: Chéri(e), veux-tu ___ avec moi sous la Tour Eiffel au clair de lune?
exercises.explanation: 'Danser' (dance) evokes a classic romantic image under the Eiffel Tower. 'Manger' (eat), 'parler' (talk), and 'marcher' (walk) are less fitting activities for a moonlit moment.

exercises.sentence: Après notre promenade, nous allons ___ un café chaud dans ce petit café confortable.
exercises.explanation: 'Boire' (drink) is the logical action to take with a hot coffee. 'Acheter' (buy), 'visiter' (visit), and 'regarder' (watch) don't make sense in the context of consuming a beverage.

simulation.title: A Parisian Romance: Lost and Found in Translation
simulation.setting: Two young travelers, Alex and Sophie, are on a romantic getaway in Paris. Alex wants to surprise Sophie by using French, but he's just a beginner. This scene captures their humorous attempts at communication during a picnic by the Seine.

content.speaker: Narrator
content.target_language_text: Alex et Sophie sont à Paris pour un pique-nique romantique.
content.phonetics: a.lɛks e sɔ.fi sɔ̃t‿a pa.ʁi puʁ‿œ̃ pik.nik ʁɔ.mɑ̃.tik
content.base_language_translation: Alex and Sophie are in Paris for a romantic picnic.

content.speaker: Alex
content.target_language_text: Bonjour, ma chérie! J'ai... euh... apporté des choses délicieuses.
content.phonetics: bɔ̃.ʒuʁ ma ʃe.ʁi ʒe... ø... a.pɔʁ.te de ʃoz de.li.sjøz
content.base_language_translation: Hello, my darling! I... uh... brought some delicious things.

content.speaker: Sophie
content.target_language_text: Oh, Alex! C'est très gentil. Qu'est-ce que tu as?
content.phonetics: o a.lɛks se tʁe ʒɑ̃.ti kɛs.kə ty a
content.base_language_translation: Oh, Alex! That's very kind. What do you have?

content.speaker: Alex
content.target_language_text: J'ai... du pain, du fromage, et... des fruits. Et du vin!
content.phonetics: ʒe dy pɛ̃ dy fʁɔ.maʒ e de fʁɥi e dy vɛ̃
content.base_language_translation: I have... some bread, some cheese, and... some fruits. And some wine!

content.speaker: Sophie
content.target_language_text: Parfait! Mais, Alex, tu parles français maintenant?
content.phonetics: paʁ.fɛ me a.lɛks ty paʁl fʁɑ̃.sɛ mɛ̃t.nɑ̃
content.base_language_translation: Perfect! But, Alex, are you speaking French now?

content.speaker: Alex
content.base_language_translation: Yes! I... I'm trying! For you.

content.speaker: Sophie
content.target_language_text: C'est adorable! Alors, dis-moi, quel est ton fromage préféré?
content.phonetics: se.t‿a.dɔ.ʁabl a.lɔʁ di mwa kɛ.l‿ɛ tɔ̃ fʁɔ.maʒ pʁe.fe.ʁe
content.base_language_translation: That's adorable! So, tell me, what is your favorite cheese?

content.speaker: Alex
content.target_language_text: Euh... le fromage... est... bon. Très bon!
content.phonetics: ø lə fʁɔ.maʒ ɛ bɔ̃ tʁe bɔ̃
content.base_language_translation: Uh... the cheese... is... good. Very good!

content.speaker: Sophie
content.target_language_text: Haha! Tu as encore beaucoup à apprendre, mon amour.
content.phonetics: a.a ty a.kɔʁ bo.ku a.pʁɑ̃.dʁə mɔ̃.n‿a.muʁ
content.base_language_translation: Haha! You still have a lot to learn, my love.

content.speaker: Narrator
content.target_language_text: Ils rient ensemble, le soleil se couchant sur la Seine. L'amour n'a pas besoin de mots parfaits.
content.phonetics: il ʁi ɑ̃.sɑ̃blə lə sɔ.lɛj sə ku.ʃɑ̃ syʁ la sɛn la.muʁ na pa bə.zwɛ̃ də mo paʁ.fɛ
content.base_language_translation: They laugh together, the sun setting on the Seine. Love doesn't need perfect words.
